Articles.Content: What's the current weather status?

if the weather is too bad i hope that they will reschedule the launch and not just launch falcon 9 without even trying to land it like last time...

I really prefer the older dragon logo, the one with the wings. the new one is seriously meh if you ask me

There's a NASATV pre-launch news conference scheduled for today at 5PM EDT.

http://www.nasa.gov/content/spacex-pre-launch-news-conference-ksc/

Pre-launch news conference is happening now.

NASATV: http://www.nasa.gov/multimedia/nasatv/#.VKvHYXum2u8

Edit: Still a 40% chance of weather violating launch constraints. However, sea conditions will be good for a landing attempt.

Edited April 12, 2015 by Airlock
This always makes me smile!

Freaking school always messing my rocket livestreams up.

You guys better post nice screenshots while I'm gone, hopefully everything will go as planned. I'll be dropping rep like a madman once I get home.
What perfect timing for anyone near BST!

I forgot on what website we can watch the stream... Can anyone please tell me ? thanks

EDIT : i think i found it, its on spacex webcast right ?

Edited April 13, 2015 by Hcube
I get back from school literally 15 minutes before launch.. Perfect Timing.

if the weather is too bad i hope that they will reschedule the launch and not just launch falcon 9 without even trying to land it like last time...
SpaceX are contracted to supply the ISS. If it's safe to launch then they'll do so. What SpaceX want to do with the spent stages of their rocket should have no bearing on the contract.

Imagine if you were expecting a parcel on Tuesday and you were then told it would be delayed until Friday because UPS want to test a new brand of tyre, you'd be pretty cheesed off wouldn't you.

I forgot on what website we can watch the stream... Can anyone please tell me ? thanks

EDIT : i think i found it, its on spacex webcast right ?

As it's a NASA launch, it'll be on NASA TV.

SpaceX are contracted to supply the ISS. If it's safe to launch then they'll do so. What SpaceX want to do with the spent stages of their rocket should have no bearing on the contract.

Imagine if you were expecting a parcel on Tuesday and you were then told it would be delayed until Friday because UPS want to test a new brand of tyre, you'd be pretty cheesed off wouldn't you.

Well if the following conditions were met:

1) I was the one shipping and/or receiving parcel

2) I got a discount in shipping costs

3) In the event I was shipping the parcel, I also had approval from the receiver of said parcel

Then no, I would not mind having my parcel delayed while UPS (or whoever) decided to test out their new tire (or whatever). However it would have to be a good discount and a limit on the maximum delay.
I'm going to go ahead and call the launch scrubbed for the week due to weather. It's hideously nasty at the moment.

I'm going to go ahead and call the launch scrubbed for the week due to weather. It's hideously nasty at the moment.

Yeah, it's not looking good. SpaceFlightNow is reporting that the "latest weather forecast issued this morning continues to indicate a 60 percent chance of acceptable conditions". So it's almost down to a coin flip.
From what I understood the weather is actually better at the landing site (the barge) than at Cape Canaveral

Part of me wishes that its delayed so that I can get home and watch it in real time, but I would rather them just be able to land the darn thing in good weather.

Godspeed, rocket!

Part of me wishes that its delayed so that I can get home and watch it in real time, but I would rather them just be able to land the darn thing in good weather.

Godspeed, rocket!

Same, I had to accept an offer to go see the 5th season of Game of Thrones premier on the big screen, and launch is 27 min before it ends. Worst case I'll excuse myself for 10 min to see the launch and find out about the landing.

So it's almost down to a coin flip.

Maybe something will finally go in SpaceX's favor this time.
Scott Manley did a thing. Some of his landings looked like the last attempt a few months ago.
10pm GMT, Hmm, definitely watching this.
I'm going to do everyone a favour and not watch. That way it will launch first time...

I'm going to do everyone a favour and not watch. That way it will launch first time...
